abstract: |
  Understanding the manifold impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic is an ongoing challenge likely
  to stretch well into the coming months and years. The pandemic continues to impact nearly
  every sector of the economy and many aspects of everyday life. Numerous, regularly updated
  COVID-19-specific datasets track the effects of the disease. Here, we describe an
  open-source, open-development software that currently provides access to 15 publicly
  available data resources routinely cited and used to understand the COVID-19 epidemic.
  The project usilizes the the R programming environment and, therefore, can leverage
  existing R statistical, epidemiologic, reporting, and interactive visualization tools. 
  Extensive economic, demographic, political, and spatiotemporal data resources are 
  available in the R data ecosystem that facilitate flexible and reproducible data fusion
  and integration. We employ software development best practices to promote robust data 
  reuse and reproducible research.
